With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt involving taking down a drug den, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Ruined House of the Damned
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The river Styx flows past this ruined house in the hells, bound by chains and containing a glowing red book.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt involving mass suicide and a bet for souls, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: The Abyssal Shelf
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This underground cavern is filled with life, but it drops away into abyssal darkness. Darkness that is filled with horrible, maddening, moving shapes; giant tentacles. Could this be the entrance to R’lyeh?

boardgame.name: Underdark Crystal Cavern
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A forboding underdark cavern, filled with glisening light crystals and many tunnels leading deeper into the depths. A large chasm splits the cavern into where creatures of the depths reside.

boardgame.name: Pirate's Coral Encrusted Ship Graveyard
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This ruined ship graveyard has been overgrown by coral, and turned into a secret lair by pirates. Ships have become haphazard rooms and living quarters, while prison cells have been carved deeper into the coral.

With this map and its system-agnostic one-shot adventure featuring bureaucratic pirates who gain magical powers from the suffering their paperwork causes, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Pirate's Shipwreck Cavern Ruins
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This ruined ship graveyard has been overgrown by coral. While it might once have been a secret lair, with ships becoming living quarters, and prison cells having been carved deeper into the coral, it has long since been abandoned...

With this map and its system-agnostic one-shot adventure featuring giant, sentient (and rather anti-bipod) lobsters created by a wizard who believed conscious food was the most delicious, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: 100 Items in a Netrunners Pocket
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Netrunners are the lords of the data stream. Using interface sockets and plugs to speak to machines with their minds, the runner still lives a life in the real world with the limitations of their flesh. Whether they still enforce the mob, fight corporate power, or work to undermine the military, they can access anything anywhere.

This list is intended for any dark future setting (like Cyberpunk Red, Cyberpunk 2020, Carbon 2185, Neon Blood, Retropunk, Veil 2020, Altered Carbon, Shadowrun, Beta Red, Lowlife 2090, Android, Rifts, etc.) where high technology is running rampant, and inhuman programs lie in wait to pounce on the weak. This list can be applied to an empty locker in a hidden lair, a pale hacker looking for a night on the town, or a corporate sysop chilling between runs. This roleplaying tool gives you dozens of different ways to add a new dimension to your next web warrior.

boardgame.name: English Name Generator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

English Name Generator creates a long list of names that are common (and uncommon) in England! This set of seven lists includes 100 male given names, 100 female given names, 50 unisex names, and 100 family names. This gives you 10,000 combinations of male names, 10,000 female names, and 5000 unisex names if you pair a first and last name together. Need more? Just add a middle name for even more variety.

Whether planning adventures in advance, creating NPCs, or during a game session when the players surprise you, there’s no telling when you’ll need some English names. This product is system agnostic and works in any world where English people live and flourish. This generator of 25,000 potential English names fits entirely on one page and is easy to use. The random list allows a natural mix and variety of names.

boardgame.name: German Name Generator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

German Name Generator creates a long list of names that are common (and uncommon) in Germany! This set of seven lists includes 100 male given names, 100 female given names, 50 unisex names, and 100 family names. This gives you 10,000 combinations of male names, 10,000 female names, and 5000 unisex names if you pair a first and last name together. Keep in mind that German people often have a given middle name for even more variety.

Whether planning adventures in advance, creating NPCs, or during a game session when the players surprise you, there’s no telling when you’ll need some German names. This product is system agnostic and works in any world where German people live and flourish. This generator of 25,000 potential German names fits entirely on one page and is easy to use. A random list allows a natural mix and variety of names.

boardgame.name: 350 Names for 1920's Speakeasies
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Speakeasy is a term for an illegal bar or restaurant that sold alcohol between 1920 and 1933 (the time of prohibition). The development of the speakeasy helped to change the United States by ushering in the notion of dating, mixing the races and sexes over drinks, and a new sense of lawlessness into the country. Many cities had thousands of speakeasies during prohibition, and each could become a place of intrigue, conflict, romance, and adventure.

This system-agnostic roleplaying product is built for the Roaring 20’s genre of games (like Gangbusters, Call of Cthulhu, Pulp Hero, Justice Inc., etc.).

boardgame.name: Magic Staff Description Generator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Magic staffs are the mark and focus of wizards, warlocks, witches, sorcerers, clerics and druids from across the world and across fantasy stories everywhere. And yet, each staff has its own specific appearance, story and origin that define it's powers and place in the world.

This tool is system agnostic and can be applied to any fantasy game (such as any version of Dungeons and Dragons, Pathfinder, Runequest, Palladium, Call of Cthulhu, etc.) or superhero game where mystic relics and tools exist. This set of nine tables allows the Game Master to define what the staff is made from, what component in the core of the staff energizes it, what pieces bind and contain the staff for strength, and what symbols, runes, physical features, magic effects, and hints regarding the origin of the staff. Each table has its own paragraph of instructions to help you understand and interpret what the results mean and hints about the staff’s power.

boardgame.name: Wild West Bounty Generator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The concept of bounties and bounty hunters has been around since people first managed to successfully escape into the wilderness to evade the long arm of the law.

This list is intended for any game in the Wild West genre (like Boot Hill, Tall Tales, Deadlands, Wild West, etc.). Whether the fugitive is a lowdown thief or an innocent framed for a crime they didn’t commit, this table can help you generate a fugitive with an interesting background, and more than just a number placed on their head.

This product uses a set of nine tables / charts to generate details about the fugitive, the crime, the bounty itself, the original victims of the crime, and the current circumstances. The tables use twenty sided dice (1d20) and ten sided dice (1d10).

boardgame.name: Thru-Hiker
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"I stand at the terminus, pack on my back, trekking poles in hand, excitement in my veins. I savor the moment. A cold mountain breeze carries the scent of rain and adventure, and I smile. I’ve waited endless months for this day and, taking a deep breath, a grin on my face, I begin my thru-hike. One foot in front of the other, I set out and follow the blazes."

THRU-HIKER is a journaling game of telling stories of long-distance hiking. Using your writing instrument of choice, a pack of playing cards, and a series of writing prompts, you will create stories of the joys and challenges of being on the trail for days, weeks, or months at a time.

Designed for those dreaming of their own thru-hike, and writer-adventurers in search of new narrative challenges, THRU-HIKER is an easy game to learn for experienced gamers and newcomers alike, one that's sure to deliver hours of imaginative fun.

boardgame.name: Do You Remember Rock?
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Earth is being invaded by fearsome Aliens, but the Space Navy is ready to defend the planet, armed with variable-form fighters and awesome rock & roll. In the midst of war, the Human Pilot, the Music Idol, and the Alien Ace fight battles while figuring out their feelings for each other.

DO YOU REMEMBER ROCK? is a roleplaying game for a gamemaster and one to three players inspired by the popular anime of transformable fighters, love triangles, and rock music. Players take the role of an iconic character, and play to resolve their emotional issues with the use of a music Playlist to drive conflict resolution.

boardgame.name: Skellington
boardgame.description:
Skellington is a may-follow trick-taker played with dominoes. The relative strength of the suits may change from trick-to-trick but the players’ choices will dictate how the strength will change.

You can play any tile you wish, in whichever orientation is best. Each tile is worth the difference from its highest number to its lowest number (e.g., a 6-1 tile is worth 5 tile points).

There are 71 tile points to capture each round (a bonus tile point is awarded to the last trick winner). However, only the side that takes the majority of these points will score victory points.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

boardgame.name: Neon Goons of the Toxic Wasteland Rulez Lite!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Do you want to play in the Neon Lords of the Toxic Wasteland world but are bogged down with the massive Core Rulez? Well look no further! Neon Goons of the Toxic Wasteland is based off of Tunnel Goons! In these pages you will find all the rules lite you will need to enjoy a quick slime-ridden vomit punk over the top good ole game!!!!
boardgame.rpg: Neon Goons of the Toxic Wasteland

boardgame.name: Shogun Dynasty
boardgame.description:
Shogun Dynasty is a fast and fast paced card game of different clans in Japan struggling to take power over all Japan as the Shogun. Using only 20 cards, it is extremely portable and can be played almost anywhere.

Shogun Dynasty is played as a series of games. Players are knocked out of a game until the winner is determined. The winner of the series is the first to win 3 games or to win a game with the Emperor.

Players have a hand of one card. On their turn they draw one card and play one of their two cards, keeping the other as their hand.

Cards can be played face up or face down, with different effects. Cards played face up take effect immediately. Cards played face down take effect at the start of the player's next turn. And players may discard the face down cards of other players before they take effect.

Card effects may knock a player out of the game. At the end of the game, the remaining player with the highest ranking card in their hand wins.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Taking Out The Street Trash
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Solo Romp for Neon Lords of the Toxic Wasteland

You were a Carnage Cop and a damned good one too. That all changed the day Rattlesnake brand trash water hit the streets turning every hobo into a pile of neon goo. In a freak accident your partner fell victim to the Rattlesnake. With what's left of your puddle of a partner in your hands the only mission on your mind is revenge.

Take the fight to the Rattlesnake bottling plant. No warrant needed.

Play as a solo class Carnage Cop and dish out some serious violations with some of the most rad hardware this side of the neon wastelands. It’s so cool you swear they are illegal.
boardgame.rpg: Neon Lords of the Toxic Wasteland

boardgame.name: Spawn a Crusty Sensei
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A quick down and dirty [process] that creates a Crusty Old Master for the party. They will gain infinite knowledge from this ancient master and gain a pretty sweet ability! Just don't let ‘em die or get kidnapped! Or else bad things can happen! Who is their rival? Where do they hang out? A bunch of d6 tables will tell you all you need to know!
boardgame.rpg: Neon Lords of the Toxic Wasteland

boardgame.name: Slay 'em All
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Someone is making illegal burger patties and it's up to you and your party of Scumdogs to find out who it is and put an end to em! This pamphlet adventure was a Kickstarter exclusive but for just one buck it can be yours too!
boardgame.rpg: Neon Lords of the Toxic Wasteland

boardgame.name: It Came from the Sewers II
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It Came From the Sewer II is a random sewer crawl generator for Thirsty for More!: Solo Rules and Adventure for Neon Lords of the Toxic Wasteland. Don't fret all you non solo players, this bad boy can be used as an adventure as well!

Detroit-Prime has a CHUD problem. The sewers are brimming with ‘em! An ancient problem required a modern solution. Dr. Mindscrambler and his cronies created the ultimate CHUD killing machine, THE DECIMATOR! Unfortunately, they have become sentient and have been attacking Municipal sewer workers and the colonies of hobo cults that live in the sewers. It’s up to you, and you alone, to brave the tunnels and take down the Decimator Mother Computer and bring peace to the Sewer Dwellers!
boardgame.rpg: Neon Lords of the Toxic Wasteland

boardgame.name: Ape Warlord x Party Beholder
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The zine includes the Ape Warlord class and the Party Beholder monster!
boardgame.rpg: Neon Lords of the Toxic Wasteland

boardgame.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 268 - Jun 2022)
boardgame.description:
Game Trade Magazine
Issue 268
June 2022

Dungeons & Dragons Frameworks - Customize your Minis

boardgame.name: Ninja High School Action Deck
boardgame.description:
Now you have an Action deck to go with your copy of Ninja High School for Savage Worlds. All the art is by the talented Ben Dunn, and the gaphic design is done by the equally talented Morne Schaap.

If there are other games you want to play, this deck can be used for that too. Our goal is to help you have fun, so go to it.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Kletterranke
boardgame.description:
Deep in the Amazon rainforest, a small people live on a rocky plateau, far from any civilisation.

Only a huge climbing vine - called Pi`i Pua by the inhabitants, the "climbing flower" - connects their village to the ground.

Every year, a group of young hunters is sent into the jungle to hunt. Who will be the first to climb the climbing vine that leads back to the village and thus receive the honour of asking for the hand of the chief's daughter?

The aim is to play the cards as well as possible in each round and to reach the home village as quickly as possible. In the process, however, attention must also be paid to other people, because everyone wants to climb the mighty climbing flower first.

How do you climb the vine?

Everyone gets a certain number of cards in their hand at the beginning. The rest become the draw pile. The starting card is placed in the middle of the table, the target card four edges above it.

When it is your turn, you choose from one of three possible actions:

When climbing, you place a card from your hand on edge against the vine and move up as many spaces as indicated on the card (or even less).

You can jump over your climbing opponents, but you must never be on the same field.

Make sure that at least one transition fits, otherwise you might have taken the wrong turn ...

If you decide with the second option that you would rather just explore the area, draw a card from the draw pile and move one space further.

As a last option, you can also cut the vine. To do this, you take a card from the draw pile into your hand. Of course, you only do this if there is no one on the card at the time. In addition, another card must not completely lose the connection.

If you are on a card with a flower during the game, you can perform two actions in your turn.

You can use a beetle card to replace a card that is already on the table, which then goes under the draw pile.

You cannot cross over beetle cards, so use them cleverly to block each other's way. By capping them, you can always use them somewhere else.

The first of you to reach one of the target fields has not only earned the respect of the entire tribe, but may also ask for the hand of the chief's daughter.

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Neo Noir
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb

In einer Welt, die von Megakonzernen kontrolliert wird, entscheiden die Reichen und Mächtigen darüber, was Recht und Gesetz ist. Doch nicht jeder fügt sich in sein Schicksal. Wer keine Antworten auf seine drängenden Fragen nach Gerechtigkeit erhält, der wendet sich bisweilen an Privatermittler: Abgebrühte „Schnüffler“, die sich von Drohungen und Gewalt nicht beeindrucken lassen, um an ihr Ziel zu kommen. Und wer die Wahrheit ans Licht holen möchte, muss bisweilen in die Schatten hinabsteigen ...

Neo Noir ist eine Eigenproduktion von Pegasus Press und eine Anthologie für Shadowrun 6 mit drei Einzelabenteuern. Alle Abenteuer sind komplett spielfertig, inklusive Grundrissen und Plänen. In den Fußstapfen großer Privatermittler der Detektivfilme durchstreifen die Runner in Neo Noir die Metroplexe der ADL. Sie lösen dabei Mordfälle, decken Konzernintrigen auf und üben Rache für vergangenes Unrecht.

boardgame.name: Stranger Things: Attack of the Mind Flayer – Hopper
boardgame.description: Promo tile of Hopper to add a new character to the base game (no special ability, just a new illustration)
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Stranger Things: Attack of the Mind Flayer

boardgame.name: AdvenTourist: Természeti kincseink
boardgame.description:
In this game, you own a travel agency. Your task will be to manage touristic regions in Hungary. This time, you will focus on natural values: hills, lakes etc.
From season to season, you must upgrade services (like hiking trails, historical places) and build attractions in your regions, then attract tourists to earn money and victory points.
At the end of the game, the player with the most victory points will be the winner.

boardgame.name: Terraforming Mars: Merger Promo Card
boardgame.description:
This is the summer 2022 promo card.

Merger is a Prelude card that lets you draw 4 Corporations, play one of them and discard the other 3. Then you pay 42 M€.

So you get a second Corporation.

listing.notes:
NEW!
Includes: *Merger (2022 Summer Promo Card.)
+Shipping
PayPal and Venmo payment preferred. Bitcoin also accepted.
Pristine new Card with fast shipping and excellent feedback!
PayPal-fee (if any) is at expense of the buyer.

boardgame.name: Inferno: Card Game
boardgame.description:
Inferno is an “anti-pick up” styled survival strategy card game. The aim is to be the last surviving player, to do this you will need to collect cards to help you avoid negative events. By picking up cards, it also increases your chance of encountering dangerous events. The cards which help you navigate the deck do not only help you avoid danger, but can strategically place your opponents into danger.

Their demise is your survival.
There can only be one survivor!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: A Torch in the Dark
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:

THE DEAD LORDS HAVE ARISEN!
The People's Revolution has overthrown the nobles of the realm and seized the Imperial capital of Kynburgh. The Emperor Titan Kyne died cursing the land and all who deposed him. Now the only coin that is left lies buried with the undead Lords who forged the Empire. Delve into the dungeon, twice-kill the dead Lords, and secure the People's Revolution!

A SINGLE-PLAYER RPG FORGED IN THE DARK
Using a single-player stream-lined variation of John Harper's Blades in the Dark rules, players can quickly generate characters with unique skills and items. As you delve you use your creativity and limited resources to overcome 100's of encounters, randomly generated from 9 unique dungeon locations. When your pack is full of broken crowns and Imperial coins you return above ground to the Imperial capital for downtime where your character can recover and resupply for their next delve.

If you succumb to your wounds you die!

If you become corrupted by diabolism and the wealth of the dungeon you die!

If your last torch burns out in the middle of the pitch black dungeon you die!

The only way to live is to kill the ghoulish nobility in their crypts, steal back their wealth, and survive to delve again. For the realm! For the people! For the Revolution!

boardgame.name: Longboard: Surf’s Up Promo Pack
boardgame.description:
Promo pack featuring 7 new cards: 3 objectives and 4 beach scenes.

The three objectives are:
Twin Fin (4 pts) - Two boards with identical values.
Shortboard (3pts) - Board with no number over 5.
Hang Ten (3 pts) - Board with 10 cards.

There are 4 beach background cards consisting of two different designs.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Strands
boardgame.description:
Strands is a 2 player puzzle game designed with help from artificial intelligence.

The players take turns placing pieces on a hexagonal board, each trying to create the largest connected group.

The board's center is the most powerful place to put pieces, but you can place more pieces per turn near the edge. You must navigate this tradeoff to win.

An AI was used to determine how many pieces you can place on each region of the board, so all regions are balanced.

The AI used was called a Monte Carlo Tree Search. By having it play many games against itself on each of many different boards, it was possible to determine which boards were most balanced for the AI.

Specifically, it was possible to quantify the likelihood that the AI would place a stone on each space, at each stage of the game.

Then we identified the boards where those likelihoods were most evenly distributed across spaces at each stage.

—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: War Comes Early
boardgame.description:
War Comes Early (WCE) is a low to intermediate complexity two-player alternative history wargame. It investigates the parameters of the six weeks of the conflict that would have resulted had the Czechoslovakians refused to accept the Munich Agreement. Had they been willing to fight the Soviets were pledged to come to their aid as fully and directly as possible. That intervention would have immediately escalated the crisis beyond a Czech German one and into the realm of a major war. The game is restricted to covering the hypothetical war’s first six weeks in October and the first half of November. That is because none of the participants had the logistical wherewithal to to go on fighting longer than that without a pause to resupply.

—descriptions from the publisher

Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: The Crimean Campaign
boardgame.description:
The Crimean Campaign, 1941 -42 (TCC) is a strategic level two-player wargame (with strong operational undertones) of low-intermediate complexity covering the fighting across the peninsula that climaxed with the German capture of Sevastopol.

The action simulated in the game took place historically between 28 October 1941 and 4 July 1942. The first date marks the German entry into the Crimea via the Perekop Isthmus, while the second marks the end of organized Soviet resistance across the whole peninsula. Those nine calendar months are divided into chronologically varied and unequal numbers of turns. That approach allows for the convenient simulation of the ebbs and flows in the action that took place due to bad weather and logistical and command-control constraints.

The Perekop Isthmus fight, which took place from 24 September through 27 October, just off-map to the north, is not included in the game because it took place across terrain too restrictive to allow for maneuver by either side. At this scale it would have come down to how lucky the German player got in rolling his inescapably low-range and mid-range initial frontal attacks. So that episode is considered to have taken place as the last act of the Dniepr River campaign rather than the first act in the Crimean campaign.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Kaiserkrieg!
boardgame.description:
Kaiserkrieg! (‘Emperor’s War’) is a strategic solitaire game of the First World War of 1914-1918. As the player, you control the Central Powers (“CP”; Germany, AustriaHungary, Turkey and Bulgaria). The game’s automatic systems direct the efforts of the Entente Powers (“EP”; France, Britain, Russia, Italy, Serbia, the United States, and their minor allies) who are trying to defeat you. As in many of my games, you play the “bad guys.” For simplicity’s sake, Imperial Germany and its main ally, the Austro-Hungarian Empire, are usually treated as one political entity in the game. The flags on the “City” Tiles are for decoration. In contrast to my other games, space precludes the addition of many historical notes in this rulebook. If you run across a name or historical reference that is new to you, Google is your friend! The heart of the game is its depiction of the ground war, which saw the battlefield deaths of some ten million soldiers. Kaiserkrieg’s treatment can be traced back to Darin Leviloff’s inspired Israeli Independence (2008) and the “States of Siege” system it started. The evolutionary leap in Kaiserkrieg! is the shift from the old ‘horizontal’ States of Siege model – where enemy forces converge on your central position along clearly defined lines of advance – to a new ‘vertical’ model where enemy forces mass in separate regions around you, to eventually achieve an advantage in size that threatens your overall position. This adaptation allows Leviloff’s original concept to more closely simulate the trench warfare realities of World War I on the continental level. The game also depicts the epic naval struggle of proGerman blockade runners trying to evade fleets of British cruisers. Many historians identify the failure to outwit the British naval blockade as the main reason for Germany’s defeat in the war. The ‘sideshow’ war in the Near East, where Germany’s Ottoman Turkish ally was assailed by Russia and the British Empire – including a massive army of Indian troops – is played with a simplified version of the game system (12.0). This theater also includes East Africa, where a German-led Black African army (the Askari) held out against Indian and British Empire forces even after the Germans in Europe had surrendered! The game is an extremely strategic view of the conflict. Points are dramatically simplified to make it playable and to emphasize the “cool stuff” of World War I, like Zeppelins, trenches, and U-boats.

Kaiserkrieg! is not a detailed historical simulation, but a fun and challenging game covering the salient themes of the actual conflict while whetting the player’s appetite for more detailed treatments of this fascinating war.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Great European War
boardgame.description:
Great European War is a two-player game of an alternative World War II in Europe, based on the premise that Adolf Hitler did not order the invasion of the Soviet Union in June 1941. Instead, the Axis goes over to a naval-air offensive against the British with additional operations in North Africa and the Middle East, while waiting for America to enter the war and keeping a watchful eye on Stalin who may intervene.

The game assumes that the Western Allies decide on a Europe First Strategy, diverting forces and logistics from the Pacific. The Axis is under pressure to win the war before economic collapse sets in, the Allies to win before the Japanese seize too much of the Pacific. Given the shift in Axis logistics and planning against the British Empire and the US. only the westernmost Soviet Union is shown on the map, but there is emphasis on North Africa and the Middle East.

There are two players: Axis and Allied (to include the Western Allies and the Soviet Union). Both players can develop orders of battle by expending Mobilization Points. The game shows the war in Europe during the early and mid-war years before the full Allied buildup. Both sides will be fighting a war which is markedly different from that fought in the historical event. The game ends in 1943, the time when the Western Allies originally planned to return to Europe.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Taierzhuang
boardgame.description:
This game includes two separate and distinct battles. Both battles use many of the same rules and concepts, however for ease of play, the rules are separated into two distinct rule sets. The first set of rules cover Stalin’s First Victory and the second The Battle of Taierzhuang. Both games are low complexity two-player grand tactical games. Stalin’s First Victory (SFV): Covers the five-day campaign that determined the outcome of the 1929 Sino-Soviet War.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Ame no Kirifuda
アメノキリフダ (Heavenly Trump)
boardgame.description:
In アメノキリフダ (Ameno Kirifuda), players play a trick-taking game where the winner of a trick places a chip on a 4x4 grid in the row corresponding to the suit of the card they played.

The suits of the cards represent the seasons, and the trump mechanism used is that the lead suit is subordinate to the "next season".

In addition to the cards used to take tricks, players draft cards which will grant points based upon having chips in certain suit patterns on the board. Players also earn points for having chips on the board, regardless of these cards.

The game lasts for two rounds and the person with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Torre Alta
boardgame.description:
Torre Alta is an introductory-level hex and counter wargame, set in a fictional European medieval kingdom. Players take on the role of princes fighting for the throne of their dying father, the king.
Published in Espaço T Magazine, a general interest Portuguese magazine from the 1980s, as a detachable cut and mount game.

boardgame.name: The Game of BUFFALO
boardgame.description:
Any number of persons can play the Game, from two up. The mode of playing the Game with but two Players is different than when played by three or more.

It will be seen that the Deck is composed of Books consisting of four Cards each, and the name of the Book is indicated by the center line in large type on all four Cards constituting any one book. The top line of each Card indicates which particular Card that Card is of a certain book. The three bottom names on each Card indicate, for the convenience of the Player, what the names or top lines of the other Cards composing that particular Book are.

The object in a game is for a Player to acquire all the Cards composing any one Book. When he has accomplished this he places the four Cards on the table before him to be counted as one trick at the end of the Game, unless he shall lose said Book in the manner described in the following rules.

boardgame.name: Splito: Goodie 42
boardgame.description:
The back of this card is an additional common objective, added at the start of the game alongside the other two.

When at the end of a round the sum of the Splito cards of an area reaches exactly 42, this objective is placed in the area in question.
It is definitively validated and the area can receive other Splito cards.

If several areas reach this amount at the same time, this objective is discarded.

boardgame.name: Majo No Ichigeki Takuhaibin
魔女の一撃宅配便 (Witch's Shot Delivery Service)
boardgame.description:
In 魔女の一撃宅配便 (Majo No Ichigeki Takuhaibin, or Witch's Shot Delivery Service), players work for a...hypothetical courier delivery service, "amajon". It is a trick-taking game for 3 to 4 players, and in each trick, the players give their packages to the winner of the trick to deliver. (In theme, the packages are going to the same location, need the same refrigerated truck, etc.)

At the start of a hand, each player drafts a quota card which shows how many of their own packages they should deliver. The card also includes a chart showing the health of the player's spine. For each successful delivery, the player's spine worsens, and if they overexert themselves, they'll damage it more quickly. Some packages may also be heavier than expected.

At the end of a hand, players earn points for each trick won, and a bonus if they hit their quota exactly. The game ends after a number of rounds, and players lose points for any permanent damage they've done to their spine. The player with the most points wins.

listing.notes: Local pickup in Washington, DC also welcome.

boardgame.name: Company of Heroes: 2nd Edition
boardgame.description:
"Company of Heroes", the World War 2 board wargame, is based on the video game from Relic/Sega. It closely captures the choices, tactics and mission strategies of the videogame. In teams, or as individuals, players will maneuver units and battle for control points to collect manpower, munitions and fuel. Players spend these resources to construct new buildings, purchase units and upgrade abilities, eventually unlocking the powerful end-game units of their nation.

The Second Edition of the Company of Heroes Board Game introduces extensive improvements to gameplay, tactical choices, unit balance, faction differentiation, mission parameters and more.

More Units - Bigger Battles: 2nd edition adjusts unit and building costs, resource generation and other mechanics to allow for more units to be purchased, fielded and used over the course of the battle.

Community Feedback: After thousands of games and feedback from the player community, the 2nd Edition further tweaked and balanced units, factions and commanders to a high polish. These changes were incorporated with an eye towards emphasizing faction identity and distinction.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: The Genius Gems
boardgame.description:
Each player receives their own Genius Gems grid and a set of the ten, double-sided clusters of gems. Roll five of the dice inside the shaker and they will land in the five coloured wells. Now race your opponent to fill every space on the grid using the ten clusters, so that the patterns shown on the dice appear simultaneously on the grid, in the correct colours.

All 10,794 puzzles have at least one possible solution. As soon as somebody finishes first, re-roll the dice and play again! Will you stick to using the basic dice, or up the ante and include the dastardly and/or devilish dice?

There may be times when it seems impossible, but there will ALWAYS be at least one solution... and that’s what makes it a ‘Genius’ game!

boardgame.name: Henchman
boardgame.description:
A light, fast-playing card game for 2-6 players featuring player interaction, some backstabbing, and a healthy dose of humor. Picture the office meets Sword & Sorcery.
Work for an Evil Overlord—a tyrannical, ruthless, megalomaniacal villain bent on world domination. launch an epic competition of subterfuge, deceit, and backstabbing to prove who is most worthy to become the next Henchman!

A modified deck builder with the entire deck building mechanic occurring at the beginning of the game. Players choose from the 6 minion characters each with their own advantages and natural skills.
The game begins with the Minion Working Phase which is divided in rounds. Each round is split into a series of steps for each minion to complete: assign tasks, initialize time, demonstrate skills, complete tasks and refresh hands to earn points, skills and reputation. One player acts as the MIC (Minion in Charge) and uses the task deck to indicate status. This is the time to demonstrate delegation and negotiation skills to curry favor with the Evil Overlord (EO).

The MIC draws a number of tasks equal to the number of minions under their delegation. The MIC then hands out these tasks to minoins as they see fit for them to complete, managing time. Any tasks not completed will an increase to the Evil Overlord Annoyance tracker (the EO has no tolerance for minions who cannot complete simple tasks!) Any tasks the MIC chooses not to complete will cost them time and points as will any failed tasks by minions. Be careful your minions could choose to strategize against you to become the next MIC. Minions complete tasks to demonstrate skills, gain abilities, points and reputation in attempt to take over as the next MIC to get their chance to please the EO and become the henchman.

The game ends if there are not enough tasks to assign to minions including reshuffled tasks. The minion that has gained the most reputation points earns the respect of the Evil Overlord and is declared the Henchman and the winner of the game.

boardgame.name: The Rugrats Movie Board Game
boardgame.description: The aim of the game is to proceed around the board by rolling dice. The first one to reach the "Hospical" is the winner!

boardgame.name: Everest Challenge
boardgame.description:
Spin for your chance to make it to the top first. Use teamwork to find the best way up but watch out, a fall is only a spin away

Players have two different climbers with pegs in their feet. They spin a spinner and climb up the side of the mountain but watch out! Their is only room for one climber in each peg so your opponent can very quickly knock you out! First to have both climbers to the top wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Squadrons: Star Citizen Strategy Card Game
boardgame.description:
Squadrons is an immersive strategy collectable card game which lets you command your favourite ships from the Star Citizen universe and compete with other players both in duel and multiplayer matches.

Squadrons is very catchy and beginner-friendly, but with increasing game experience it offers a very multi-faceted game.

The resource system was deliberately minimized with a focus on tactical action, rousing space battles and dogfights.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Crawl
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:

Crawl is a setting agnostic game for running crawls (hex, point, dungeon, etc.) using rules built off of the Iron Core mechanic designed by OpalBreeze Games. It is designed to be quick to learn and easy to adapt to the setting of any adventure or setting you may want to run (horror, fantasy, sci-fi, etc.) without any changes or reflavoring of core mechanics. With every roll you will be forced to prioritize Success, Speed, Supplies or your own Physical and Mental Health, balancing your sacrifices in order to press on.

Feel free to modify, break, or borrow any parts of Crawl except for the Iron Core mechanic which OpalBreeze Games has their own rules for use of and crediting.

boardgame.name: Aventuras en la Marca del Este. Reglamento básico
boardgame.description:
Bienvenidos a Aventuras de la Marca del Este.

La Marca del Este es un mundo rebosante de aventuras, personajes de leyenda, monstruos, oscuras mazmorras, inexpugnables fortalezas y magia poderosa.

Por fin, después de mucho esfuerzo, llega reedición de Aventuras en la Marca del Esta.

Se relanza la primigenia «caja roja» de Aventuras en la Marca del Este, editada originalmente por el Grupo Creativo de la Marca del Este. Fue posteriormente prolongada y expandida con la edición de Holocubierta, hasta hoy.

Tras exhaustivas revisiones, traer una nueva edición remozada, pulida y expandida de Aventuras en la Marca del Este.

¿Qué incluye la reedición de Aventuras en la Marca del Este? Dentro de esta reedición de Aventuras en la Marca del Este, podrás encontrar:


Caja contenedora en cartoné rígido.
Manual básico: 192 páginas encuadernación rústica, interior en b/n.
Clases de aventurero básicas y avanzadas.
Reglas opcionales de CA positiva.
Compilación de las reglas básicas y avanzadas de las anteriores cajas.
Pantalla del Narrador: tres cuerpos en cartoné.
Libreto de hojas de personaje: 50 hojas de personaje encoladas.


Si siempre has querido explorar La Marca del Este, esta es una gran oportunidad y llevarte todos los tesoros que incluye la nueva Caja Roja.
boardgame.rpg: Aventuras en la Marca del Este
boardgame.rpgpublisher: Grupo Creativo La Marca del Este

boardgame.name: Sonderburger Seeschlacht-Spiel
boardgame.description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to reach the harbor of Sonderburg (space 100) wins the game.

Plastic sailships were available as supplements to bags of Harry-Sonderburger bread.

boardgame.name: 1:0 für Babette
boardgame.description: The players move the ball on the game board according to the results of a spinning top (with results from 1 to 6). When a player loses control of the ball, the other player gets his turn. After a predetermined time the player with the most goals wins the game.

boardgame.name: Far West: Pantalla del DJ
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Un buen comisario necesita las mejores herramientas para hacer valer la ley en la Frontera. Para ello os presentamos la nueva pantalla del Director de Juego para Far West La Leyenda, un elemento indispensable que reúne las principales tablas para controlar de forma óptima el desarrollo de tus aventuras en el Salvaje Oeste.

La lujosa presentación en 4 palas a todo color de 297 mm x 210 mm está culminada con las impresionantes ilustraciones del artista norteamericano Andy Thomas

La pantalla del Director de Juego viene acompañada por dos libretos de 24 páginas DIN-A4 a todo color: la “Recopilación de tablas de juego” y “Los Pacificadores”.


En el primer libreto encontrarás todas las tablas contenidas en el Manual de reglas básicas actualizadas, para facilitarte una rápida consulta y agilizar tus partidas.
“Los Pacificadores” incluye nuevos arquetipos de personajes, armas especiales para tahúres, una ampliación de las reglas de Juego y Juegos de manos para las partidas de cartas, reglas adicionales imprescindibles para el trampero fronterizo y una completa aventura que os sumergirá en el sangriento conflicto de la ruta Bozeman hacia Montana.

boardgame.name: Apache, guía de tribu
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Apache es una completa guía de tribu para Far West La Leyenda que se adentra en el peligroso Sudoeste, el hogar de uno de los pueblos nativos más emblemáticos y, sin duda, el más feroz y persistente en su resistencia contra la invasión del hombre blanco. Repleto de exhaustiva información de ambientación, nuevas reglas de juego especialmente orientadas a esta brava tribu y cuatro emocionantes aventuras, Apache transporta a los jugadores al corazón de un conflicto épico, donde sólo los más duros y decididos logran sobrevivir. Salvaje Oeste en estado puro.

Esta Guía de tribu incluye:


Minuciosa información sobre el entorno, sociedad, clanes, costumbres y tradiciones apaches, incluyendo sus efectivas tácticas de combate y las de sus oponentes habituales.
Una detallada cronología de las guerras apaches, además de información sobre sus destacados protagonistas.
Nuevas reglas de juego que incluyen creación de personajes apaches, arquetipos específicos, nuevas armas, conjuros y aptitudes especiales.
El módulo ¡Apache!, una vibrante aventura que traslada a los aventureros al centro de la acción de las Guerras Apaches, en una misión de vital importancia para el devenir futuro de la región.
Tres aventuras adicionales, incluyendo historias especialmente pensadas y desarrolladas para aventureros apaches, que beben del misticismo y las tradiciones de este singular pueblo.

boardgame.name: Historias de la Frontera
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Bienvenido al lugar donde los hombres intrépidos y valerosos se enfrentan a golpe de revólver a cuantos desafíos les aguardan. Un territorio indomable, regado por la sangre de los débiles, repleto de codiciosos emprendedores sin escrúpulos que negocian con plomo, bandidos sanguinarios que acechan en los crueles caminos y tribus nativas en pie de guerra. Una tierra repleta de historias épicas merecedoras de un grupo de aventureros dispuestos a inscribir su nombre en La Leyenda. Bienvenido a la Frontera.

Historias de la Frontera es un compendio de siete aventuras independientes y totalmente inéditas para Far West La Leyenda diseñadas para ser completadas en un máximo de dos o tres sesiones de juego. En cada uno de los diferentes y apasionantes escenarios los aventureros se enfrentarán a distintos retos que desafiarán su capacidad de supervivencia y pondrán a prueba su carácter y valía para convertirse en auténticos nombres legendarios de la Frontera.

Historias de la Frontera incluye las siguientes aventuras:


Meredosia, última parada. La recepción de un inquietante telegrama arrastrará a los aventureros a una búsqueda implacable para esclarecer lo sucedido y pondrá en juego el futuro de la Illinois Central Railroad y su propia reputación.
Cibolero. En un pacífico pueblo transformado en ardiente camposanto por una oscura culpa, la Justicia tiene las horas contadas para derrotar a la ley del Talión que descarga su furia contra culpables e inocentes por igual.
Winter Wolves. El descubrimiento de una joven brutalmente asesinada a las afueras de South Pass City amenaza con desencadenar una ola de venganza y violencia en la región del Wind River. ¿Lograrán los aventureros dar con el culpable y proteger el precario equilibrio del distrito minero?
Polvo y lágrimas. Bajo el sol abrasador de Arizona y la constante amenaza de los apaches, una sencilla misión de escolta se tornará en una frenética persecución por liberar a una inocente.
Camino a Perdición. Una cabalgada tras una banda de asaltantes de diligencias se transformará en auténtica pesadilla cuando el grupo de perseguidores se adentre en los montes malditos de Puerto Blanco y se enfrente a sus mortíferos secretos.
La última batalla de Crazy George. La desesperada llamada de auxilio de la viuda de un antiguo compañero de aventuras conduce a los PJ hasta Red Hills, un lugar sometido al férreo control de un despiadado terrateniente que pretende hacerse con todas las tierras y el control de la región.
Sin retorno. El regreso de un viejo camarada de armas dado por muerto reagrupa a los muchachos del antiguo pelotón con la intención de recuperar un importante botín escondido. Tras la pista del dinero también se encuentra Steve “Bloddy knuckles” Bruce y su banda de despiadados forajidos dispuestos a liquidar a todo aquel que se cruce en su camino…

boardgame.name: El oro de la Unión
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

El oro de la Unión es una aventura completa para Far West La Leyenda, el juego de rol del Salvaje Oeste. Un respetado ranchero de Kansas busca revólveres a sueldo para sacar de apuros a un pueblo que no vive su mejor momento, asolado por una banda de criminales. Una situación límite solo apta para aventureros curtidos cuyos valores y lealtades serán desafiados por los diversos intereses de una región bajo el yugo de los secretos del pasado.

La popular historia que acompañó la pantalla original de Far West el juego de rol en 1993 ha sido totalmente puesta al día, mejorada y adaptada a Far West La Leyenda, en un suplemento digital y gratuito que hará las delicias de los seguidores del juego más salvaje del Oeste.

boardgame.name: Holland's Hope
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Holland’s Hope es una aventura corta introductoria para Far West La Leyenda, el juego de rol del Salvaje Oeste. Corre el otoño de 1866 y los aventureros se encuentran recorriendo los caminos del norte de Kansas que conforman la ruta hacia Oregón, dejando atrás un Este devastado por cuatro años de guerra civil y buscando forjarse un nuevo y próspero futuro al otro lado de las Rocosas. A través de Kansas transcurre la ruta principal hacia Oregón. Una red de caminos que parte desde Independence y Kansas City (Misuri) siguiendo por el sur del río Wakarusa hasta el monte Oread y Topeka, donde diversos servicios de transbordadores permiten cruzar el río Kansas y proseguir el curso del Little Blue hasta alcanzar Fort Kearny en Nebraska; allí la ruta se ramifica en diferentes direcciones…

boardgame.name: Meanwhile, in the subway
boardgame.description:
publisher blurb

The subway runs below the city; no map binds it and what happens in its hallways is never completely coherent.
Each station is unique and a source of unexpected adventures.
Each passenger, when met, turns out to be someone amazing.
Sometimes, people leave the subway, bringing the memories and dreams of their stories with them…

MEANWHILE, IN THE SUBWAY IS:


A setting for games such as Itras By, Troika or Electric Bastionland
A standalone game with its own system which requires a GM and 3 to 5 players, and can be played as a 2-hour one-shot adventure or as a longer campaign
A beautifully laid-out, double-sided, imaginary subway map you could proudly display in your living room


You'll like this game if you enjoy atypical situations, whimsical adventures and thinking on your feet!

boardgame.name: Aquelarre: Pantalla del DJ
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

La nueva pantalla de Aquelarre es una ayuda indispensable para tus partidas del juego de rol demoníaco medieval.

Sus características son:


Tres paneles a todo color con una ilustración exclusiva de Jaime García Mendoza realizada expresamente para la ocasión, con una medida total de 835 x 218 mm.
Tres paneles con las tablas más relevantes y resúmenes de reglas para facilitar tu trabajo como director en medio de la partida.

boardgame.name: Los Infortunios del Deslechado
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A la ermita del santo Pelayo, cerca del nacimiento del río Boeza, unos romeros acudieron al atardecer del día 26 de junio, festividad del santo. Comieron y bebieron, y se sentaron mirando al santo, dispuestos a cumplir con la sagrada tradición del Filandón.

En esta ermita de san Pelayo existe la costumbre, para todos tenida por santa, de que si la noche previa a su fiesta se le cuentan historias y narraciones, al modo de un “filandón” como se hace en esas tierras, el santo corresponde trayendo prosperidad a la comarca durante todo un año. Y a eso han venido estos romeros. Y ya el primero bebe un trago de vino para aclararse la garganta, carraspea un poco y empieza.

Aquí da comienzo la primera parte del Filandón de San Pelayo, una tragicomedia en cuatro partes con epílogo moralizante, que tiene por nombre Los infortunios del Deslechado. Esta aventura conducirá a los jugadores a La Segarra, en la Corona de Aragón, durante en tenso reinado del rey Pedro IV, donde recibirán los encargos, un tanto especiales, del comerciante Pompeu Porta de Gerunda.

Entre sus páginas encontrarás, además, una amplia lista de personajes, nuevas criaturas y hechizos, y numerosas ideas de aventura con las que expandir la historia.

Los infortunios del Deslechado está escrita por Ricard Ibáñez y es la primera aventura de la colección Cofradía Anatema para Aquelarre, el juego de rol demoníaco medieval.

boardgame.name: Por el país de Oc
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

El Filandón de San Pelayo: Por el País de Oc

En la ermita de San Pelayo, el segundo de los romeros inicia su relato. Y, como pasó con el primero, todos callan y atentos escuchan.

Gerunda, enero de 1348.

El comerciante catalán Pompeu Porta de Gerunda vuelve a requerir a los nuestros amigos protagonistas, que tan buenos servicios le prestaron en el pasado, ya que le urge que su nuera tenga descendencia. Ha oído hablar de un tal san Foutin, milagrero en problemas de virilidades cansadas y simientes agotadas, además de ser patrón de la ciudad francesa de Lyon. ¡Hasta el mismísimo Infierno arrastraría a su familia con tal de solucionar su problema y tener un nieto!

Y para este viaje sí se necesitan muchas alforjas, y bien llenas de cuidados y siete ojos, pues los caminos y senderos son en estas horas lugares cobijo de los que aprovechan las ganancias de los pescadores en aguas turbias.

En estas páginas encontrarás variopintos personajes, algo de investigación, doctos señores, tentaciones ultraterrenales y misterios dignos de quienes protagonizarán esta épica tragicomedia en cuatro partes. Por el País de Oc está escrita por Ricard Ibáñez y es la segunda aventura de la colección Cofradía Anatema para Aquelarre, el juego de rol demoníaco medieval.

boardgame.name: El Reino del Cuarto Jinete
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

En esta tercera aventura de la campaña El Filandón de San Pelayo, los personajes deberán abrirse camino por una ciudad apestada y tratar de poner remedio a tan grave situación, con la ayuda de un viejo loco y un hechizo prohibido y salvador. Aparte del mencionado hechizo y de un buen plantel de personajes dramáticos, estas páginas incluyen una nueva criatura y un apéndice sobre Villa Real en 1350.

boardgame.name: En Tierra de Elfos
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Cuarta parte del Filandón de San Pelayo, la tragicomedia con epílogo moralizante para Aquelarre. En Tierra de Elfos, por Ricard Ibáñez, es la cuarta y última aventura de la colección Cofradía Anatema para Aquelarre, el juego de rol demoníaco medieval.

Con esta última y épica aventura concluye El Filandón de San Pelayo, una tragicomedia en cuatro partes con epílogo moralizante. Entre sus páginas encontrarás también numerosas criaturas nuevas, notas sobre la interpretación de los mitos griegos durante la Edad Media y un apéndice sobre la Seu de Urgell.

boardgame.name: Terra Nullius
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Los habitantes de la frontera vivieron una vida aventurera y llena de peligros, siempre dispuestos a tomar las armas, cabalgar por sus paisajes agrestes y sobrevivir a matanzas, saqueos y venganzas.

Terra Nullius te permite trasladar los sangrientos y complejos conflictos de la Reconquista a tus sesiones de Aquelarre. Los Reyes Católicos se preparan para derribar las últimas fortalezas de al-Ándalus, y ya se ven ondear los pendones de órdenes militares y señores feudales, mientras el estruendo de la pólvora anuncia el fin de una época.

En este suplemento encontrarás:


Una completa descripción del territorio de al-Ándalus durante la época de la Reconquista, desde el origen y el estado de las tensiones entre nazarís y castellanos, pasando por sus paisajes y fortalezas, hasta los grupos y personajes que habitan esta tierra fronteriza.
Nuevos cargos, oficios, orgullos y vergüenzas para crear personajes en la frontera.
Detalles y consejos para transmitir los peligros y la violencia de la época, desde los saqueos y la destrucción de las algaras o aceifas hasta las frecuentes celadas.
Los secretos de la magia mudéjar, incluyendo nuevos grimorios y hechizos.
Costumbres y leyendas nacidas de la mezcla de culturas de la Franja y nuevas criaturas como el Cerigüelo o la diablesa de la fiebre Umm Mildam.
La campaña Frontera en llamas, que tiene lugar veinte años antes de la conquista de Granada, en plena guerra civil castellana.

boardgame.name: Imago Europe. Volumen 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Con Imago Europe (Volumen 1), el universo de Aquelarre cruza por fin los Pirineos y amplía su escala geográfica y dramática. Os daréis de bruces con algunos de los más grandes conflictos del Medievo, entre ellos la Guerra de los Cien Años, madre de tantas otras guerras que sacudirán Europa durante el próximo siglo. No solo es tiempo de enormes batallas, también de peligrosas intrigas y oscuras conspiraciones, un delicado pero sangriento juego entre nobles decadentes que se encierran en el lujo y el pecado para huir de los horrores de la guerra mientras dejan sus tierras en las corruptas manos de sus vasallos. Un tiempo de papados enfrentados, Roma y Aviñón, dispuestos a todo por mantener su hegemonía sobre una cristiandad que no les importa quebrar durante el proceso.

Como si no tuviéseis ya suficiente con vivir en una península ibérica que huele a leña, la noche tomada por seres que no pertenecen al racional reino de Dios, las ciudades infestadas de enfermos y menesterosos, las iglesias criando herejías y las costas hasta la cencerreta de piratas.

Queda mucho por conocer, mucho por afrontar. El Aquelarre ya no tiene fronteras.

En este suplemento encontrarás:


Una detallada descripción del Reino de Francia y las Islas Británicas. El estado de sus Ducados, Principados y Dominios, su situación política y social, sus personajes históricos relevantes y sus criaturas irracionales.



Una cronología centrada en las nuevas regiones y los reinos aledaños durante la época de Aquelarre.



Una nueva campaña, La reliquia sagrada, repleta de nuevos conflictos y misterios por resolver, al otro lado de los Pirineos.



Nuevas clases de personaje y pautas adicionales para crear personajes británicos y franceses.

boardgame.name: Imago Europe. Volumen 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Si con el primer volumen de Imago Europe el universo de Aquelarre cruzaba por fin los Pirineos, con este Volumen 2 prosigue el viaje a través de un continente donde la leyenda y la historia danzan juntas entre las sombras de bosques salvajes y pueblos remotos. Mientras un poeta ensalza la grandeza de Roma, seis mil almas perecen ahogadas al desbordarse los grandes ríos durante el día de María Magdalena y los caballeros teutónicos tratan de sofocar una rebelión contra el gobierno alemán. Este es el tiempo de los últimos vikingos acechando en el mar del Norte, de los emperadores y papas tensando el tapiz de un mundo que verá llegar a sus costas barcos desde Crimea repletos de cadáveres y hombres agonizantes. Con ellos, de la mano del mismo Demonio, llegará la peste negra que asolará Europa.

Amplía el alcance geográfico y dramático de tus aventuras demoníaco-medievales con Imago Europe: Volumen II. Queda mucho por conocer, mucho por afrontar. El Aquelarre ya no tiene fronteras.

En este suplemento encontrarás:


Información detallada sobre los reinos escandinavos, el Sacro Imperio Romano-Germánico y los países italianos, incluyendo su realidad política y social, sus personajes históricos relevantes y sus criaturas irracionales.
Una cronología centrada en las nuevas regiones y los reinos aledaños durante la época de Aquelarre.
Una guía sobre las maravillas de la ciudad de Roma.
La campaña Los viejos dioses, dividida en tres partes, en la que los PJ visitarán Escandinavia, el Sacro Imperio e Italia.
Nuevas clases de personaje y pautas adicionales para crear personajes escandinavos, germánicos e italianos.

boardgame.name: The New Marvel-Phile (Issue 58)
boardgame.description:
Better finish packing up, and make sure you use the restroom before we leave, because it's road trip time! A few of our favorite authors have written up their hometowns (or at least some of their favorite towns) and included some fun plot hooks to use.

So gas up the Quinjet and get ready to go exploring!

boardgame.name: The Eternals
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

There are those who believe that life here began out there, far across the universe... with powerful beings who may have been the forefathers of the Greeks or the Romans or perhaps even the Aztecs. Some believe that even now they fight to survive as Eternals locked in battle against the forces of the demonic Deviants, serving their masters the Celestials and safeguarding humanity against forces to great for normal man to deal with.

This book is over 180 pages and includes the description of the Eternals and Deviants, as well as stats and histories for many of those representing each faction.
boardgame.rpgseries: MA - Marvel Superheroes Advanced Game Accessories

boardgame.name: Rise of the Serpent
boardgame.description:
A new drug is quickly taking over the streets. In addition to the rise of crime committed by those seeking a way to pay for their next fix, the drug seems to have some unfortunate side effects in some people who take it. The heroes must take to the streets and find a way to stop this new drug crisis before it brings the city to its knees.

This adventure has been designed for flexibility. No particular city or locations are used. Nor are any specific heroes meant for this adventure. It should be easily adaptable to any excising campaign. Each encounter should offer enough information and option to help any Judge, regardless of experience or creativity level, to run an interesting adventure. The final encounter also includes options for keeping some of the plot threads going long after the initial adventure has ended.
boardgame.rpgseries: MH - Marvel Super Heroes RPG Adventures

boardgame.name: Alarún
boardgame.description:
Under the watchful eye of the old druid Alarún, you will collect mysterious ingredients, obtain the rarest herb and mix and match them into powerful potions. Secretly score bonus points and take over Alarún's migthy staff as the best druid apprentice.

Alarún is a card game with more depth in it then you would have thought at first sight.

The game of Alarún plays in 8 rounds, each in the same way. In these 8 rounds you place 24 ingredients that form your magic square of 5x5 cards. Your druid apprentice completes your magic square.

During a round you chose 1 of the 3 available actions, after the first player passes every other player can take 1 more action.


Swap 1 ingredient from your hand with 1 of the 3 ingredients that are face up in the centre of the table.
Pass Do not swap an ingredient.
Swap and pass: Swap all 3 ingredients from your hand with all 3 ingredients that are face up in the centre of the table. This is a pass at the same time.


Score most points by brewing powerful potions and scoring bonus points along the way. During the game you collect 24 ingredients and combine them in the best possible way into your own magic 5x5 square. At the end of the game your magic square is complete. The ingredients in every row and every column form potions that will score you points.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Malki
boardgame.description:
The basic game is played with 2 or 4. The game for advanced players can be played with 2, 3 or 4 players. The Malki game is best served with 4 colors.

The objective of the game is to conquer the Center of the board with your King. Each player disposes of 9 pieces on the board (and 4 spare pieces), representing The King, the watchmen (guards), the warlords and the sorcerer.

Malki is a game of magic that reveals more and more of its depth as you play it. Mind-marvelling.

boardgame.name: Nation In Arms: Color Printed Second Edition Playbook and Rulebook
boardgame.description: Nations in Arms brings one of the most famous periods in history to your gaming table: the French Revolution and the legend of Napoleon in Europe, from 1792 to 1815. This epic treatment of the Napoleonic period covers 24 years of warfare at the strategic level.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Nations in Arms: Valmy to Waterloo

boardgame.name: Tricky Dicks: The Richard Measuring Contest
boardgame.description:
The adult card game about describing your Richards. How do you decide Victory? By claiming to have the Longest, Shortest, Thickest, or Thinnest picture of Richard in your hand. Any Challengers? Whip out the ruler card and see which Richard is best! No matter what party you're in, Tricky Dicks will fit right in.

Go around in a circle playing cards and claiming if you have the biggest, smallest, thickets, or thinnest and compare with your opponents. Most points at the end of the game wins!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Who Wants To Be A Millionaire Card Game
boardgame.description:
Put Yourself in the hot seat of one of the nation's favourite quiz shows and take on the iconic money ladder. Using your wits and four lifelines, can you handle the pressure and climb to £1 million?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Robot Wrangler
boardgame.description:
Corral the robots by color or type, and the first to empty their hand wins!

To begin the game, each player is dealt 5 robots which they lay face-up in front of them. An additional robot is placed face-up next to the draw pile. On each player's turn, they can play a robot from their hand that matches the type or color of the top robot on the discard pile. If they cannot play, they must instead draw one robot and end their turn. A wild card can be used at any time, and the player can select which color they want it to represent.

The first player to play all of their cards wins.

boardgame.name: Star Tycoon
boardgame.description:
In Star Tycoon, players will take on the role of an interstellar business with the goal of out-performing their business rivals by the last round.

Each player gains Victory Points by claiming sets of planets and developing them with production facilities and other buildings.

Central to Star Tycoon is the Galactic Exchange, a fluctuating market that reacts supply and demand. Knowing when to buy and when to sell is key creating a profitable business.

—description from designer

boardgame.name: X-Men: Mutant Insurrection – Domino
boardgame.description: Following the announcement of X-Men: Mutant Insurrection last summer, the votes were cast to introduce a new hero to the dice-driven card game. It is that time to release the winner! The winner of the poll was the ever-popular probability manipulator, Domino. With luck on her side and a whole lot of firepower, Domino is a powerful addition to any team in X-Men: Mutant Insurrection. Domino is a free print-and-play that is available on Fantasy Flight's website.

boardgame.name: Aeronautica Imperialis: Companion
boardgame.description:
Aeronautica Imperialis – Companion is an expansion book for Aeronautica Imperialis games.

The perfect addition to any Aeronautica collection, it contains new rules, aircraft, and factions for games of Aeronautica Imperialis, as well as collating previously published content from White Dwarf magazine into one handy volume.

Inside you will find:
- Rules for fielding a Necrons force in games of Aeronautica Imperialis, including three aircraft profiles, along with upgrades and Ace Abilities
- Rules for fielding the full force of the Asuryani in games of Aeronautica Imperialis, including four all-new aircraft profiles: Vampire Raider; Vampire Hunter; Nightshade Interceptor, and Hemlock Wraithfighter.
- Rules for fielding all four Adeptus Astartes aircraft, collated in print for the first time
- A collection of aircraft profiles for existing factions not previously available in print, including the Marauder Pathfinder, Marauder Colossus, as well as rules for Looted aircraft for the Orks Air Waaagh! and Gue'Vesa Auxiliary aircraft rules for your T'au Air Caste
- New and exciting ways to play, including expanded damage rules, allowing for more detailed air combat, new Ace Abilities, Limited Ammunition rules and a dedicated set of matched play scenarios
- A suite of campaign rules allowing players to track the progress of their squadron over a series of games from rookies through to highly skilled Aces.

Please note that you will need a copy of the Aeronautica Imperialis rules in order to fully use the contents of this book.

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: The Path Seekers
boardgame.description:
The Path Seekers is a sandbox tabletop experience that brings players back to an ancient China fantasy world. You are playing as one of the young protagonists who starts off with a modest background. With tremendous hard work and determination, you set off living your dream to make a difference in this treacherous time.

On players' turn, they will perform two main actions using multi-use Actions cards to move around and interact with locations on the board to improve their protagonist's attributes, and to befriend all kinds of interesting characters to help you with their special powers.

You may travel to visit different clans, learn from more than 20 new skills in the form of Action cards to execute more challenging missions, explore the uncharted cave for what lies within or hunt dangerous animals to gain precious resources and go on many more adventures. Prestige will be earned in many ways from successful missions, event interactions, gold and virtue etc.

At the end of twelve months, the player with the most Prestige will be titled the winner.

Will you succeed on your quests to gain a prestigious reputation or succumb to the growing pressure and regress into obscurity? Your journey starts now as The Path Seekers.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Bushido: The Card Game
boardgame.description:
A samurai push-your-luck, set collection game. Take to the Dojo and Roll dice, allocating them to the available Virtues. Learn enough Virtues of the Bushido Code to impress one of the visiting Daimyo in order to win!

Many of the Virtue cards dynamically alter the game when collected. Focus tokens can force a player to reroll any die at any time - and each of the Daimyo have a special ability to help or hinder training!
